intro: Rubus × viduatus, commonly known as the blackberry bramble, is a hybrid plant in the Rosaceae family. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces aggregate fruits composed of small, drupe-like berries. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodland edges and disturbed soils. Its botanical features make it a common weed in agricultural and natural settings.
